snippet: A ruling by the state’s highest court said that a 2009 budget that dropped about 29,000 legal immigrants from Commonwealth Care violated the state Constitution.
abstract: Massachusetts highest court rules that state cannot bar legal immigrants from a state health care program; decision edges Massachusetts closer to its goal of providing near-universal health care coverage to its residents.
lead_paragraph: A ruling by the state’s highest court said that a 2009 budget that dropped about 29,000 legal immigrants from Commonwealth Care violated the state Constitution.

headline.main: Massachusetts Health Plan Extended to Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Health Plan Extended to Immigrants
